subject: Public Speaking
title: Gandhi's First Courtroom Speech
description: A 60-second lesson on Gandhi's First Courtroom Speech.

hook.text: Gandhi's first case as a lawyer was a disaster. He stood up to cross-examine a witness and couldn't say a word.

buildup.text: He froze completely, sat down, and refunded his client's fees. He called it the most humiliating moment of his life.

discovery.text: Gandhi spent years avoiding courtroom speaking. He turned to writing and private negotiation instead.

twist.text: When he finally found his cause â€” Indian independence â€” his conviction overcame his fear. Purpose defeated anxiety.

climax.text: Gandhi proved that the right cause can unlock a voice that fear has silenced for years.

punchline.text: The man who freed India once couldn't speak in court.

quiz.question: What happened during Gandhi's first courtroom speech?
options: He froze completely and refunded his client
